raw_text:
Mutu to hold talks with Juventus
 
 Disgraced former Chelsea striker Adrian Mutu is to begin talks with Juventus as he looks for a new club.
 
 "Mutu will be in our club's main stand to watch the match between Juventus and Fiorentina," said a Juventus official, who declined to be named. "Then he will meet some important people of the club," he added. Mutu, 25, sacked by Chelsea and banned for seven months for taking cocaine, is now represented by Alessandro Moggi, son of Juve manager Luciano Moggi. Mutu, banned by the English FA, can resume playing next May. He is to undergo a drug education and rehabilitation programme. Mutu wants to train with Romanian side Dinamo Bucharest whilst serving his ban, say the Bucharest side.
llama3.2:1b: Adrian Mutu will hold talks with Juventus, where he will meet key personnel in the club. Mutu was sacked by Chelsea and banned for 7 months; he is represented by Alessandro Moggi. He wants to train with Dinamo Bucharest while serving his ban, which begins May next year.
llama3.2:3b: Adrian Mutu will hold talks with Juventus after watching their match against Fiorentina in their main stand, as he seeks a new club; his ban from playing expires next May.
gemma2:2b: Adrian Mutu will meet with Juventus officials to discuss potential club options.  Mutu is seeking a new club after being banned for cocaine use and hopes to play again next May. He plans to train with Dinamo Bucharest during his ban.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Former Chelsea striker Adrian Mutu will speak with Juventus as he seeks new club, 25, sacked by Chelsea, banned for seven months by FA. He can resume playing in May after undergoing drug education and rehabilitation program.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Former Chelsea striker Adrian Mutu will meet with Juventus representatives following his ban for cocaine use.
qwen2.5:3b: Adrian Mutu, formerly of Chelsea and now banned for seven months due to cocaine use, will begin talks with Juventus as he seeks a new club. Mutu, 25, is represented by Alessandro Moggi, son of Juventus manager Luciano Moggi. The striker can resume playing in May after completing a drug education and rehabilitation program. Romanian team Dinamo Bucharest claims Mutu wants to train there during his ban, though it's not confirmed.
smollm:1.7b: Mutu will be in our club's main stand to watch the match between Juventus and Fiorentina. Then he will meet some important people of the club.
deepseek-r1:1.5b:
<think>
Okay, I need to summarize the given text concisely while preserving key ideas and details. The user provided a detailed paragraph about Adrian Mutu joining Juventus after being suspended for drug use.

First, I should identify the main points: Mutu's suspension from Chelsea, his return toJuventus, his representation by Alessandro Moggi, his training plans with Dinamo Bucharest during the suspension period, and the drug education and rehabilitation program he expects.

I need to condense this into a summary without losing any important details. Let me structure it step by step.

Start with Mutu joining Juventus as part of his return from Chelsea. Then mention that he's represented by Alessandro Moggi, who is the son of Juve manager Luciano Moggi. He has been suspended for drug use and will start talks there. He's now looking to train with Dinamo Bucharest during this time.

I should make sure each sentence flows logically and covers all key points without being too wordy. That way, the summary is clear and captures everything important from the original text.
</think>

Adrian Mutu, a former Chelsea striker suspended for drug use, will join Juventus following his return from Manchester United as part of his efforts to seek a new club. Represented by Alessandro Moggi, Mutu, who previously represented Juve, aims to train with Romanian side Dinamo Bucharest during his suspension period. Mutu seeks drug education and rehabilitation.
tinyllama:1.1b: Mutu will participate in talks with Juventus regarding a new club, as he seeks a move away from Chelsea. The official said that Juve is offering Mutu their main stand for a match between Juventus and Fiorentina, and that the player can then meet important people at the club. Alessandro Moggi represents Mutu's agent, while Juve is in talks with Bucharesst to allow him to train there during his ban.
tinydolphin:1.1b: Discussing recent developments in the world of football, it has been reported that Adrian Mutu, a disgraced former Chelsea striker, will be meeting with Juventus officials to discuss his interest in joining the Italian club. Mutu's representation is currently under the care of Juventus manager, and he intends to resume playing immediately upon completing his ban for taking cocaine. Mutu was initially banned from Chelsea for seven months due to his involvement with drugs, and this decision has caused him to face a long wait before returning to play professionally. As per the details, Mutu will be present at the main stand of Juventus's match against Fiorentina on October 13th, before meeting with various important figures within the club, including manager Alessandro Moggi and his son, who represents Mutu in the transfer process. Meanwhile, Mutu has been allowed to train with Romanian side Dinamo Bucharest while serving his ban, pending an evaluation of his drug use by a rehabilitation program.
phi:2.7b: Juventus' representative met with former Chelsea striker Adrian Mutu for talks about him joining their club. However, the details of the meeting remain unknown due to privacy laws. Mutu is banned from playing in England and is considering training with Romanian side Dinamo Bucharest whilst serving his ban. He is looking for a new club after being sacked by Chelsea and charged for taking cocaine.
orca-mini:3b: Disgraced former Chelsea striker Adrian Mutu will hold talks with Juventus after being represented by Alessandro Moggi, son of Juve manager Luciano Moggi. He is seeking a new club and is to undergo a drug education and rehabilitation program before resuming training with Romanian side Dinamo Bucharest.
hermes3:3b: Adrian Mutu to discuss joining Juventus.

Mutu, 25, formerly banned for seven months for cocaine use, is now represented by Alessandro Moggi, son of the Bianconeri's manager. He can resume playing in May and plans to participate in a drug education and rehabilitation program. Bucharest's Dinamo Bucharest expresses interest in having him train during his ban.

A Juventus official confirmed that Mutu would watch a match and meet key club figures. Now represented by Alessandro Moggi, son of Juve manager Luciano Moggi, Mutu can resume playing in May and will undergo a drug education and rehabilitation program. In the meantime, he hopes to train with Romanian club Dinamo Bucharest.

Mutu, currently represented by Alessandro Moggi, son of Juventus manager Luciano Moggi, is seeking a new club following sacking and seven-month cocaine ban from Chelsea. He can resume playing in May and is set to undergo drug education and rehabilitation during his ban. Mutu aims to train with Romanian side Dinamo Bucharest while serving his ban.
granite3.1-dense:2b: Former Chelsea striker Adrian Mutu, 25, formerly banned for seven months by the English FA due to a cocaine-taking offense, is set to meet with Juventus officials. This follows his sacking from Chelsea and the completion of his ban in May 2013. Mutu, represented now by Alessandro Moggi (son of Juventus manager Luciano Moggi), aims to train with Romanian club Dinamo Bucharest during his ban. The talks between Mutu and Juventus are expected to explore potential signing or contract negotiation opportunities for the disgraced player.
